x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement:
WellStaff - Tracks workload, break adherence, and burnout indicators to improve workforce wellbeing and retention. Frontline caregivers, especially in long-term care (LTC) and hospital settings, often face heavy workloads, skipped breaks, and emotional exhaustion. These factors contribute to burnout, absenteeism, and high turnover rates.
Supervisors often lack real-time insight into:
Who is overworked or consistently missing breaks Staff reporting fatigue or emotional distress Shifts that exceed safe working hours Trends in overtime or short-staffed coverage
Without early detection, wellness issues escalate into performance decline and increased risk of care errors. WellStaff monitors fatigue and wellness indicators in real-time, providing proactive alerts and support.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

ServiceNow products or capabilities used:

  • HR Service Delivery (HRSD) – manage wellness cases, self-service wellness requests, and HR intervention workflows
  • Now Platform App Engine – custom fatigue monitoring app with staff workload and sentiment tracking tables
  • Flow Designer – automate alerts when wellness indicators exceed safe thresholds
  • Performance Analytics – measure fatigue trends, workload distribution, and retention improvements
  • Now Mobile App – allow caregivers to check in/out for breaks and self-report stress or fatigue levels
  • Employee Center (Portal) – provide a confidential wellness hub with tips, resources, and direct HR support
  • IntegrationHub – integrate with scheduling and biometric/IoT devices (e.g., smartwatches or shift management tools)
  • AI Search & Predictive Intelligence – analyze patterns from historical workload and sentiment data to predict burnout risks
  • Virtual Agent – offer conversational wellness check-ins and automated guidance based on reported symptoms

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

Technical dependencies:

  • Integration with existing HR or scheduling systems (e.g., Kronos, Workday)
  • Optional integration with wearable devices or smart badges for fatigue indicators (heart rate, steps, sleep)
  • Secure storage of employee sentiment and health-related data
  • Mobile app access for check-ins and notifications

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Anticipated challenges:

  • Protecting privacy and ensuring staff trust in wellness data handling
  • Maintaining engagement and regular use by caregivers
  • Integrating with third-party workforce management tools
  • Ensuring AI predictions remain transparent and unbiased
  • Preventing alert fatigue for supervisors
